subject: probability
title: Multinomial Coefficients
contentHtml: The multinomial coefficient is a fundamental concept in probability theory that helps us count the number of ways to partition objects into distinct categories.
intuition: Think of it like counting the number of ways to distribute a set of objects into different bins. The multinomial coefficient gives us the total count, taking into account the order in which we place each object.

subject: probability
title: Multinomial Coefficients
contentHtml: The multinomial coefficient is a fundamental concept in probability theory that helps us count the number of ways to partition objects into distinct categories.
name: Multinomial Coefficient
intuition: Think of it like this: you have n objects and you want to put them into m categories. The multinomial coefficient gives us the number of ways we can do this, taking into account the number of objects in each category.
commonMistakes: Forgetting that k_i! is included in the denominator
realWorldApplications: In natural language processing, multinomial coefficients are used to model the probability distribution of words in a document.

subject: probability
title: Multinomial Coefficients
contentHtml: When counting the number of ways to partition objects into distinct categories, we often encounter multinomial coefficients.
intuition: Multinomial coefficients help us count the number of ways to distribute objects into distinct categories. This is useful in many real-world applications, such as counting the number of possible outcomes in a multi-choice question.
realWorldApplications: Counting possible permutations in natural language processing
